function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Dissemination of results to various stakeholders","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Continuous assembly of data from various sources","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Significant time lags in traditional surveillance methods for health endpoints","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Geographic shift in infectious diseases leading to expansion of disease burden into new areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proactive approach to deal with drivers of infectious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Environmental and climatic conditions contributing to the upsurge of vector-borne diseases vbd such as wnf and malaria in southeast europe.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social inequality as a factor in the emergence and transmission cycle of malaria in greece, particularly among migrant workers from endemic countries.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequacy of traditional public health strategies to cope with the public health challenges associated with global environmental change and emergence of vbd in the european union.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of pathogen surveillance in the blood supply","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delayed access to healthcare for vbd patients","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Emerging vbd threats due to environmental/climate change, travel, and socio-economic factors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urbanization, urban sprawl, and high population densities are associated with vector-borne disease vbd emergence.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Habitat encroachment and destruction lead to displacement of wild animals, affecting exposure patterns to infectious pathogens.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social and demographic changes, including demographic shifts and social inequality, lead to disproportionate vulnerability to infectious diseases.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adequate surveillance systems to cope with the arrival and dispersal of tropical pathogens associated with warmer temperatures.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of blood products from donors infected with known or unknown pathogens represents a significant threat to the blood supply and public health.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Globalization and environmental change contribute to the spread of vector-borne diseases vbd","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Approximately 60% of human pathogens are estimated to be of zoonotic origin","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Land-use can indirectly determine the spread of zoonotic diseases through exposure pathways in different urban, sub-urban, and rural settings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Different effects of methods on different types of buildings could lead to inconsistent control of disease transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive effect of methods in all types of buildings may lead to a false sense of security","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Varying effects of methods in different risk buildings may result in inadequate disease prevention in high-risk buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate use of infectious prevention methods in building design and construction","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient consideration of building type in the effectiveness of prevention methods","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Concentration of participants from high-risk regions in the study","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unequal variances between buildings due to method type","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differential effectiveness of methods based on building type","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficiency of type 3 methods in low and medium-risk buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interaction effect of method and structure is not significant","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sphericity test not meeting significance level","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incorrect interpretation of test results for effects within the subjects","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Different coping methods may have varying effects in different types of buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Observed covariance matrices are not equal between different construction groups","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Significance and non-significance of multivariate tests can influence the interpretation of the study results","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The proportion of participants is significantly higher in continental europe","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The measures in design and construction have the highest score in all three types of buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The studied methods have the highest scores in high and very high-risk buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Examination of the effect of implementing prevention methods on different types of buildings may lead to the spread of contagious diseases if the methods are not effective or if the buildings are not properly managed.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Testing hypothesis about the effect of coping methods on different types of buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate or biased demographic analysis","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty of the population size of the study","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Random sampling selection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty of collecting information","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of proper training and guidance on covid-19 exposure sources and prevention measures","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Possible lack of effective preventive measures in the real estate industry","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of the relationship between built environments and covid-19 transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on outdated prevention and control methods","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of risk assessment and management in building services maintenance","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of systemic study on covid-19 response in the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient knowledge and guidance on combating covid-19 in facilities management","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
